channel.title: directory-traversal on Vie
channel.description: Recent content in directory-traversal on Vie

item.title: Bo1lersCTF 2021: Lorem_Ipsum
item.description: Lorem_Ipsum gave nothing but a simple homepage that allowed you to see “animal”-ified versions of the famous lorem ipsum placeholder text. Choose among the available animals, and notice a GET query parameter that looks something like ?animal=dogs. What if you gave it text garbage instead of an expected animal? This is a Werkzeug debugger! What fun, since Werkzeug in development mode will give you a python console with every traceback that is reported to you when something wrong happens.

item.title: Common Web Exploits: A Guide for Recon
item.description: This is mainly used as a helpful recon guide to determine what vulnerabilities are available to you as an ethical hacker or CTFer. I’ve spent quite a bit of time researching these vulnerabilities and spotting their telltale signs, and I hope to share them here. These are common or more unique vulnerabilities that I have seen, executed, and researched while doing CTFs. Disclaimer: This article is not exhaustive, and is not intended to replace any research you would perform on your own.

item.title: RedPwnCTF 2020, part 2
item.description: Part 2 of my writeup series for RedPwnCTF 2020! Let’s Begin! item.title: CONfidence 2020: CatWeb
item.description: I participated in CONfidence CTF 2020 teasers in March of this year. I was focusing mainly on this problem, and it really helped me broaden my skills in JSON-related attacks! I have never seen many JSON injections before this, so this was welcome practise.
